*edited*for clarifications (newest reply to clear any miscommunications)Look there is no harm in borrowing, even on Tun M's time. As it is healthy for the economy.(as long as it is properly managed) but, Among other things, GST helped in Reducing "Unnecessary" Borrowing. If you would take note, Below, it shows other countries that Also implements a form of GST taxing system. Is it because these other countries are "Evil"? no, it's because it is a legitimate system that is standard. I usually Poke fun at Tun M as an Evil Gambler Borrowing Money Like no Tomorrow, But it is Just to make a subtle Contrast to opposition supporters that Wail and Complain when Borrowing is done under Najib(as I see it, Opposition supporters understand next to nothing about economy). To Note, I firmly believe that Tun M is an evil Maniacal Gambler. But not with Borrowing Money, That's not bad. I deem him so for His Forex Scandals. Salam.Look:

Don't think anyone is disputing whether GST is legit or illegit, it's irrelevant.So why has the debt worsen on Najip watch that he needed GST? Under other PM, there was no need, Malaysia survived without it.

Fact is, you are cherry picking. Why are you using countries with GST to justify having GST, without comparing the rest of the components of the country's governance?And GST is not related to this topic either so YOU should heed your own words.

GST taxing system are implemented around the world with different/varying governments. From The phillipines, to Thai, to Sweden, and so on.people thought of malaysia implementing it as an "injustice". Here is another perspective. You said governance. but you pointed out about bumis rights. How are bumis rights related to the implementation of Gst? or it's necessity? It does not in fact.

Like I said, you are using tu quoque as a reasoning to justify GST without wanting to address the real issue of GST implementation, which is to increase tax revenue for govt.You are still cherry picking.
